body:
This only happened about 30 minutes ago so I unfortunately I don't really have evidence, so anyway:

I was enjoying a chilled out game of Nexus whilst on Team Speak (I didn't have my mic plugged in though) and at times I would quote in the Nexus chat what the people in ts were saying (quite immature I know).

At one point I accidentally said the word rap* (I'm not sure if it needs to be sensored) and for about 20 minutes this 7 year old by the name of spainethechamp or something like that started shouting at me saying I took his "innocence away". After a couple of games, he started making up lies such as:
I threatened to kill him 
AND
I threatened to rap* him.

He also demanded that I should be banned for this.

The irony is, even after I said sorry for saying the word, he continued to say it in every sentence.

So the question is, should I be banned?

title: Should I be banned for this?

replies.body:
From your infractions, you aren't punished for anything.
If you do not like the language in Team Speak then join a different channel where the rules are stricter such as the swearing forbidden channel.
replies.body_tagged:
From your infractions, you aren't punished for anything.
If you do not like the language in Team Speak then join a different channel where the rules are stricter such as the swearing forbidden channel.

replies.body: Wtf? U arent even banned lol

replies.body:
Personally, I'd refrain from saying anything rude in chat.
I was in the game, but I wasn't really looking at the chat much. You would definitely not be permanently banned for saying something like that don't worry :D
You'd most likely receive a warn if anything.
